names.japanese: ペットフードショップ

description: A small pet food shop in Orange Town that was owned and operated by Hocker for over a decade. After Hocker's death, his loyal dog Chouchou continued to guard the shop as his treasure and memento of his owner.

keyEvents.description: Luffy first encounters the pet food shop where Chouchou is standing guard.
Boodle reveals the shop's history and significance to Chouchou through flashbacks.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the emotional importance of the location

keyEvents.description: Chouchou bravely defends the shop from Richie's attack.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the shop's value to Chouchou

keyEvents.description: The pet food shop is destroyed and burned down by Richie while searching for food.
keyEvents.significance: The emotional climax and permanent destruction of the location

significance: Symbolizes the power of memory, loyalty, and what constitutes true treasure in One Piece. The shop itself was unremarkable, but its value to Chouchou as a memento of his owner demonstrates that treasures can be emotional rather than material.
culturalReferences: The concept of treasuring a place as a connection to a deceased loved one is common in Japanese culture, particularly the idea of maintaining shrines or special places in memory of the departed.

description: The residence of Mayor Boodle in Orange Town, where he takes in wounded visitors and townspeople who need shelter or medical care.

keyEvents.description: Boodle takes wounded Zoro to his house to nurse his injuries.
keyEvents.significance: Location debut, establishes Boodle's compassionate nature

significance: Represents Boodle's role as a caring leader who looks after his townspeople and even strangers in need.

keyEvents.description: Mohji and Richie arrive in Orange Town searching for Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: Escalation of conflict with Buggy Pirates

keyEvents.description: Battle between Luffy and Mohji/Richie takes place in the streets of Orange Town.
keyEvents.significance: Major combat sequence in the town

additionalInfo.foundedBy: Mayor Boodle and others over 40 years ago
additionalInfo.note: Boodle helped transform uninhabited wilderness into a thriving community over forty years
